results.headline: Young Missourians, Hard Times
results.summary_short: The documentary “Rich Hill” chronicles the coming of age of three boys in the poor rural community of Rich Hill, Mo.

results.headline: To Honor a Teenage Girl’s Memory
results.summary_short: “Louder Than Words” follows the founding of Maria Fareri Children’s Hospital in Valhalla, N.Y.

results.headline: The Making of a Musician
results.summary_short: Alex Gibney’s new documentary looks at Fela Kuti, the outspoken Afrobeat musician and singer.

results.headline: Yee-Ha! Space Cowboy Rides to the Rescue
results.summary_short: “Guardians of the Galaxy,” starring Chris Pratt, is one of those interstellar westerns about a motley group of appealing baddies who rise to the occasion.

results.headline: Forgive Me, Father, for I Must Sin
results.summary_short: “Calvary,” John Michael McDonagh’s mordantly funny murder mystery, revolves around an Irish Roman Catholic priest.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Calvary

results.headline: The Party’s Over When the Flesh-Eating Virus Arrives
results.summary_short: A bachelor party accidentally lands on an island contaminated by a flesh-eating virus in “Cabin Fever: Patient Zero.”

results.headline: A World Without Pity Spawns a Fallen Son
results.summary_short: James Franco is the director and co-writer of a screen adaptation of Cormac McCarthy’s novel “Child of God.”

results.display_title: Rabindranath Tagore: The Poet of Eternity
results.headline: A Bengali Poet Sings Again
results.summary_short: A one-hour film intended for schools and students focuses on Tagore’s greatness as a universal soul.

results.headline: Running Frees Teenager From Family Shackles
results.summary_short: A teenager whose father dies and whose brother is using drugs finds a source of inspiration in “4 Minute Mile.”

results.headline: She Has Seen Too Much, and It Shows
results.summary_short: “War Story” centers on an overseas American photographer with a damaged psyche.

results.headline: Chasing a Chivalrous Bandit
results.summary_short: In “Kick,” a cop follows a thief to Warsaw where comedy, romance and action intersect.

results.headline: Voices and Vulnerability
results.summary_short: “The Fluffy Movie” stars Gabriel Iglesias, a comedian who talks about his spoiled son, his estranged father and risqué parenthood techniques.

results.headline: All Tribalism and Treachery, Dude
results.summary_short: Dwayne Johnson plays the title role in “Hercules,” a piece of tongue-in-cheek revisionist mythology directed by Brett Ratner.

results.headline: Rushing to the End of Adolescence
results.summary_short: The directorial debut of the Oscar-nominated screenwriter Naomi Foner, “Very Good Girls,” stars Elizabeth Olsen and Dakota Fanning.

results.headline: Its Devotees Are Diverse, and You Can Dance to It
results.summary_short: Short on the business aspects and insights, “Under the Electric Sky” is heavy on the sound and spectacle.

results.headline: 5 Soldiers, 3 Afghans and Grisly Atrocities
results.summary_short: “The Kill Team” is a documentary about one of five American soldiers accused of murdering three Afghan civilians for what has often been described in news accounts as sport.

results.headline: Metaphysical Sleight of Heart
results.summary_short: In Woody Allen’s “Magic in the Moonlight,” a magician is summoned to the French Riviera to expose a young clairvoyant who has won over a rich family.

results.headline: Deep in Her Gut, She Knows She’s Not Ordinary
results.summary_short: Luc Besson’s new film, “Lucy,” turns Scarlett Johansson from a frowzy, cheerful young woman into a killing machine.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Lucy

results.headline: When Grumpy Met Sappy
results.summary_short: Michael Douglas plays a crabby old guy who gets together with his next-door neighbor (Diane Keaton) in the comedy “And So It Goes.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of And So it Goes

results.headline: A Search and Destroy Thyself Mission
results.summary_short: In “A Most Wanted Man,” a grim German intelligence agent played by Philip Seymour Hoffman zeros in on a Chechen whom he believes he can link to terrorist cells.
